title: Behavioral Cloning for Multi-Finger Robot Hands
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

title: Policy Gradient Methods for Robotic Hand Control
abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

title: Trajectory Optimization for Dexterous Grasping
abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: Real-Time Control of Anthropomorphic Hands
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: VLA-Based Dexterous Manipulation Planning
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Advanced Dexterous Manipulation Systems: A Comprehensive Review
abstract: This comprehensive review examines the current state of dexterous manipulation systems, covering hardware advances, control algorithms, and future research directions.
conference: IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)

abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

title: Optimal Control for Multi-Fingered Robotic Hands
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model-Free Adaptive Methods
abstract: The paper presents a model-free adaptive control strategy for dexterous robotic hands. The method improves robustness against model inaccuracies and environmental disturbances during manipulation tasks.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Object Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: This research focuses on optimizing grasping and manipulation strategies for dexterous hands using advanced optimization techniques. The approach reduces computational complexity while maintaining high task success rates.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands
abstract: This paper proposes a model predictive control (MPC) framework tailored for dexterous robotic hands. The approach optimizes joint torques and contact forces in real-time to achieve stable and precise manipulation of objects.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper introduces a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation. The method decomposes complex tasks into subtasks, enabling more efficient and robust policy learning.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: The paper presents an optimization-based method for learning policies in robotic hand manipulation tasks. By integrating trajectory optimization with policy gradients, the approach achieves high performance in dynamic and uncertain environments.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The method uses a deep neural network to process visual inputs and learn policies that enable precise object manipulation in complex environments.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model that integrates visual perception, language understanding, and motor control for dexterous hand manipulation. The model is trained on a large-scale dataset of multimodal interactions with objects.

title: Dexterous Hand Manipulation via Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for dexterous hand manipulation by leveraging human demonstrations. The model is trained to replicate complex hand movements and object interactions using a combination of kinematic and tactile data.

title: Learning from Demonstrations with Uncertainty Estimation for Robotic Manipulation
abstract: This work focuses on imitation learning with uncertainty estimation to improve the reliability of robotic manipulation policies. The model accounts for variability in human demonstrations and adapts accordingly during execution.

title: Vision-Conditioned Language Models for Robotic Task Execution
abstract: This paper explores the use of vision-conditioned language models to guide robotic hand manipulation. The model generates task instructions based on visual input and executes them through a dexterous robotic hand.

abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: Learning from Demonstration for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: Multimodal Learning for Dexterous Robot Control
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Optimizing Contact Forces for Dexterous Manipulation via Model-Based Optimization
abstract: We propose a model-based optimization approach to compute optimal contact forces for dexterous robotic hands, enhancing manipulation stability and precision.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Hand Coordination
abstract: This paper proposes an end-to-end reinforcement learning approach for coordinating multiple robotic hands in collaborative manipulation tasks, achieving high task success rates.

title: Imitation Learning with Hierarchical Policies for Dexterous Tasks
abstract: We develop a hierarchical imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to perform complex dexterous tasks through structured policy decomposition.

title: Language-Guided Visual Manipulation with Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action model that uses natural language instructions to guide robotic hands in performing visual manipulation tasks.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Adaptive Feedback Linearization
abstract: This research presents an adaptive feedback linearization technique for controlling dexterous robotic hands, improving robustness in uncertain environments.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous manipulation tasks using a robotic hand. The method leverages visual feedback to improve task success rates in complex environments.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model that integrates visual perception, language understanding, and action execution for dexterous object manipulation tasks.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Manipulation via Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn complex manipulation tasks by observing human demonstrations. The model generalizes well to unseen objects and scenarios.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Learning for Robotic Manipulation
abstract: This work explores optimization-based methods for learning policies in robotic manipulation tasks, focusing on improving sample efficiency and task performance.

title: Adaptive Control Strategies for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper proposes an efficient optimization algorithm for dexterous manipulation tasks, focusing on minimizing energy consumption while maintaining task performance. The method is validated through simulation and real-world experiments.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: This work introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model that enables robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks by understanding natural language instructions and visual input. The model is trained on a large-scale dataset of human-robot interactions.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Human Demonstrations
abstract: We explore imitation learning approaches for dexterous hand manipulation using human demonstrations. The model is trained to replicate complex hand movements and adapt to different object shapes and sizes.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: We develop a model predictive control (MPC) framework for dexterous hand manipulation that accounts for dynamic constraints and contact forces. The controller is validated on a real robotic hand performing object reorientation tasks.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Imitation and Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We propose a hybrid learning framework combining imitation learning and reinforcement learning for dexterous hand manipulation. The model is trained on human demonstrations and fine-tuned with reward shaping to improve task performance and generalization.

title: Optimization-Based Methods for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper explores optimization techniques for improving the efficiency and accuracy of dexterous object manipulation. The proposed method uses trajectory optimization to generate smooth and collision-free motions for robotic hands.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Touch
abstract: This paper presents an end-to-end learning framework that integrates visual and tactile feedback for dexterous hand manipulation. The model is trained using a combination of simulated and real-world data to achieve robust performance.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Robotic Hands
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action planning system that enables robotic hands to perform multi-step manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions. The system combines vision, language, and action modules to achieve task completion.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation in Uncertain Environments
abstract: We present an adaptive control strategy for dexterous hand manipulation that adjusts to changing environmental conditions. The method improves robustness and stability during object manipulation tasks.

abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

title: Sample-Efficient Learning for Dexterous Grasping
abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

title: Efficient Optimization for Real-Time Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We propose an efficient optimization algorithm tailored for real-time dexterous manipulation, reducing computational overhead while maintaining high task performance and stability.

title: Force Control in Dexterous Grasping Systems
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Learning from Demonstration with Attention Mechanisms for Robotic Hand Control
abstract: We propose an attention-based imitation learning framework for robotic hand control, which improves task generalization by focusing on key features during the demonstration phase.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Uncertainty Handling
abstract: This paper develops a model-based control strategy for dexterous hands that accounts for uncertainties in object dynamics, improving robustness and precision in manipulation tasks.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action planning framework that allows robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks by interpreting natural language instructions and visual inputs in real time.

title: Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation Using Human Demonstrations
abstract: This paper introduces an imitation learning approach that uses human demonstrations to train a robotic hand for precise manipulation tasks, achieving high accuracy through motion capture and policy distillation techniques.

title: End-to-End Control of Dexterous Hands Using Deep Neural Networks
abstract: We develop an end-to-end control system for dexterous robotic hands using deep neural networks, enabling real-time adaptation to dynamic manipulation tasks with minimal human intervention.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper proposes an optimization-based method for learning policies in dexterous hand manipulation tasks, combining model predictive control with policy gradient methods for improved performance and stability.

title: Policy Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation in Unstructured Environments
abstract: This paper presents a policy optimization approach that enables dexterous robotic hands to manipulate objects in unstructured environments by leveraging continuous control and reward shaping techniques.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Language Guidance
abstract: This paper explores the integration of vision and language to enhance dexterous manipulation in robotic hands. We propose a vision-language-action model that enables robots to perform complex object manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions.

title: Learning Dexterous Grasping via Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We present a multi-task reinforcement learning framework for dexterous grasping, enabling robotic hands to adaptively grasp various objects under different environmental conditions using shared policy networks.

title: Efficient Optimization of Contact-Aware Manipulation Policies for Robotic Hands
abstract: We propose an efficient optimization framework for contact-aware manipulation policies that enhances the performance of dexterous robotic hands in tasks involving physical interactions with objects.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Object Manipulation with a Dextrous Hand
abstract: We develop an end-to-end reinforcement learning system for multi-object manipulation tasks using a dexterous robotic hand. The model learns to coordinate finger movements and apply appropriate forces for successful manipulation.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: We propose a model predictive control (MPC) framework that leverages learned dynamics models to enable precise and stable dexterous manipulation. The approach is validated on multiple robotic platforms with varying degrees of freedom.

title: Optimization-Based Grasp Planning for Dexterous Manipulation in Unstructured Environments
abstract: This paper presents an optimization-based approach for grasp planning that considers both object geometry and environmental constraints. The method improves the success rate of dexterous manipulation in unstructured settings.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Reorientation with Uncertainty Awareness
abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of object reorientation with a dexterous hand using imitation learning. The proposed method incorporates uncertainty estimation to improve robustness in real-world scenarios.

title: Vision-Language-Action Policies for Dexterous Manipulation in Open-Ended Tasks
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action policy that enables robotic hands to perform open-ended manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions. The model is trained on a diverse set of tasks and environments.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Manipulation Using Online Optimization
abstract: This paper presents an adaptive control strategy that uses online optimization to adjust control policies in real-time during dexterous manipulation tasks. The approach improves stability and adaptability in dynamic environments.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We present an imitation learning approach that enables robotic hands to learn complex manipulation tasks by imitating human demonstrations. The method uses a hierarchical neural network architecture to generalize across different objects and tasks.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning: A Data-Efficient Approach
abstract: This paper proposes a data-efficient reinforcement learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation tasks using visual inputs. The method combines model-based planning with policy optimization to improve sample efficiency and task performance.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model Predictive Control and Neural Networks
abstract: This paper combines model predictive control with neural networks to achieve robust and precise control of dexterous robotic hands in dynamic and uncertain environments.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Gradient-Based Methods
abstract: The paper investigates the use of gradient-based optimization techniques to improve the efficiency and convergence of policy learning for dexterous manipulation tasks in high-dimensional spaces.

title: Language-Guided Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: The paper explores how language can guide dexterous manipulation tasks using vision-language-action models, enabling robots to perform complex object manipulation based on natural language commands.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Search for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: The paper presents an optimization-based policy search method that enhances the efficiency and effectiveness of learning policies for complex dexterous manipulation tasks in high-dimensional action spaces.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: This paper proposes a model-based control approach that leverages learned dynamics models to improve the accuracy and responsiveness of dexterous hand manipulation tasks in real-time settings.

title: Learning to Grasp from Human Demonstrations: A Imitation Learning Approach for Robotic Hands
abstract: This work presents an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn grasping strategies by observing human demonstrations, achieving high success rates in unseen object configurations.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation Policies via Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper demonstrates end-to-end learning of dexterous manipulation policies using deep reinforcement learning, achieving robust performance across multiple object types and environmental conditions.

title: Imitating Human-like Hand Movements through Imitation Learning with Action Constraints
abstract: This research focuses on imitating human-like hand movements by incorporating action constraints into imitation learning, leading to more natural and effective manipulation strategies for robotic hands.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Learning for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents an optimization-based policy learning method for dexterous manipulation tasks. By combining trajectory optimization with policy gradients, the approach achieves efficient learning of complex motor skills in high-dimensional state spaces.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation Policies via Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper investigates multi-task reinforcement learning for dexterous hand manipulation, where the agent learns to perform multiple object manipulation tasks simultaneously. The approach enhances generalization and reduces training time compared to single-task methods.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation Using Neural Radiance Fields
abstract: This paper introduces a novel imitation learning framework that uses neural radiance fields (NeRFs) to represent and transfer human hand motions to robotic hands. The method enables accurate replication of complex hand movements in varied environments.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Dexterous Tasks
abstract: This paper proposes a vision-language-action planning framework for dexterous robotic manipulation. It integrates language instructions with visual perception and action planning to perform complex object manipulation tasks in unstructured settings.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents an adaptive control strategy for dexterous robotic hands that combines deep reinforcement learning with model-based control. The system adapts to varying object properties and environmental conditions during manipulation tasks.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation via Probabilistic Inference and Gradient Descent
abstract: This paper introduces an optimization framework that uses probabilistic inference and gradient descent to improve the performance of dexterous manipulation tasks. The method enhances robustness by accounting for uncertainty in sensor measurements and object dynamics.

title: Language-Guided Dexterous Manipulation via Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: This paper presents a vision-language-action model that enables language-guided dexterous hand manipulation by integrating natural language instructions with visual perception and motor control.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: We present an end-to-end imitation learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, leveraging transformer architectures to encode complex temporal dependencies in human demonstration data.

title: Learning to Grasp and Manipulate from Human Demonstrations using Imitation Learning
abstract: We present an imitation learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation, where human demonstrations are used to train a neural network policy. The model achieves high fidelity grasp and manipulation performance on unseen objects.

title: Multi-Modal Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: This paper investigates multi-modal reinforcement learning for dexterous hand manipulation, incorporating tactile, visual, and proprioceptive feedback to enhance learning efficiency and robustness.

title: Policy Optimization with Model-Based Control for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We combine model-based control with policy optimization to improve the efficiency and safety of dexterous hand manipulation in uncertain environments.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Object Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper addresses multi-object dexterous manipulation using end-to-end reinforcement learning. The model learns to manipulate multiple objects simultaneously by combining visual perception, tactile feedback, and motor control in a unified framework.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Hierarchical Policies
abstract: This paper introduces a hierarchical imitation learning framework that improves the efficiency and generalization of dexterous hand manipulation policies. The approach decomposes complex tasks into subtasks, enabling more stable and robust learning from human demonstrations.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model Predictive Control with Learned Dynamics
abstract: This paper presents a robust control framework for dexterous robotic hands using model predictive control (MPC) combined with learned dynamics models. The method improves control performance under uncertainty and varying environmental conditions.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Gradient-Based Methods
abstract: This paper investigates the use of gradient-based optimization techniques for improving dexterous manipulation policies. The approach allows for efficient policy updates and better adaptation to new tasks and environments.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: This paper proposes a model-based control strategy for dexterous robotic hands that uses learned dynamics models to improve control accuracy and reduce reliance on real-time sensing. The method is validated through simulation and physical experiments.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation via Probabilistic Inference and Bayesian Optimization
abstract: We present a probabilistic framework for optimizing dexterous manipulation tasks using Bayesian optimization. The method efficiently searches the action space and adapts to changing environmental conditions.

title: From Demonstration to Execution: Imitation Learning for Real-World Dexterous Tasks
abstract: This study investigates the application of imitation learning to real-world dexterous tasks, focusing on transferring human-like movements to robotic hands. The approach is validated through extensive experiments on a multi-fingered robotic platform.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model Predictive Control and Deep Learning
abstract: This paper combines model predictive control with deep learning to achieve robust control of dexterous robotic hands. The method improves adaptability and performance in dynamic and uncertain environments.

title: Efficient Optimization of Dexterous Manipulation Strategies Using Gradient-Based Methods
abstract: We present an efficient optimization framework for dexterous manipulation that utilizes gradient-based methods to refine manipulation strategies. The approach significantly reduces training time while maintaining high performance.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Touch: A Reinforcement Learning Approach
abstract: This paper presents a reinforcement learning framework that enables dexterous manipulation using both visual and tactile feedback. The method is evaluated on a variety of object manipulation tasks, demonstrating improved performance over traditional control methods.

title: Learning to Grasp from Human Demonstrations: An Imitation Learning Approach for Dexterous Hands
abstract: We propose an imitation learning method that leverages human demonstrations to train a dexterous robotic hand. The approach uses motion capture data to learn grasp strategies and generalizes well across different objects and environments.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Deep Neural Networks
abstract: This work explores model-based control strategies for dexterous hands by integrating deep neural networks with physical models. The approach improves stability and precision in high-dimensional manipulation tasks.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Adaptive Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper presents an adaptive model predictive control strategy that enhances the robustness of dexterous hand control under uncertain conditions.

title: Learning to Grasp from Human Demonstrations Using Imitation Learning
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn grasping strategies from human demonstrations, achieving high success rates on unseen objects.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation with Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We demonstrate an end-to-end deep reinforcement learning system that achieves state-of-the-art performance in dexterous manipulation tasks using raw sensory inputs.

title: Optimization-Based Planning for Multi-Contact Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper proposes an optimization-based planning method for multi-contact scenarios, significantly improving the efficiency and robustness of dexterous hand manipulation.

title: Imitating Human Hand Movements via Imitation Learning with Neural Networks
abstract: This paper explores the use of neural networks for imitating human hand movements, enabling robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks with high fidelity.

title: Vision-Language-Action Policies for Robotic Manipulation Tasks
abstract: We develop vision-language-action policies that allow robotic systems to perform manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions and visual input.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Contact Constraints
abstract: We introduce an efficient optimization algorithm that accounts for contact constraints, improving the performance of dexterous hand manipulation in real-world scenarios.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Sparse Rewards
abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of sparse reward learning in dexterous hand manipulation by introducing a novel reward shaping mechanism. The approach significantly improves learning efficiency and task success rate in complex environments.

title: Imitation Learning with Temporal Consistency for Robotic Hand Tasks
abstract: We develop an imitation learning method that enforces temporal consistency in robotic hand actions, leading to smoother and more natural motion sequences. The model is evaluated on a range of dexterous manipulation tasks.

title: Optimal Control of Robotic Hands with Dynamic Contact Modeling
abstract: We propose an optimal control framework that incorporates dynamic contact modeling for dexterous robotic hands. The method enhances performance in tasks involving object sliding and rolling.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation in High-Dimensional Spaces
abstract: This paper presents an efficient optimization algorithm tailored for high-dimensional dexterous manipulation tasks. The method reduces computational overhead while maintaining high task performance and stability.

title: Optimization-Based Grasp Planning for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We present an optimization framework for grasp planning that considers both geometric and physical constraints to enable robust dexterous manipulation. The method is validated on a variety of objects and manipulation scenarios.

title: Imitation Learning with Hierarchical Policies for Robotic Hand Tasks
abstract: This paper proposes a hierarchical imitation learning framework that improves the performance of robotic hands in multi-step manipulation tasks by decomposing complex actions into subtasks.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Robotic Hand Interaction
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action planning framework that allows robotic hands to interpret natural language instructions and execute corresponding manipulation actions through multimodal reasoning.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Neural Policies
abstract: We propose an efficient optimization framework that integrates neural policies with gradient-based optimization techniques to enhance the performance of dexterous hand manipulation tasks.

title: Learning to Grasp and Manipulate with Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We present an imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn grasping and manipulation skills from human demonstrations, achieving high success rates in real-world settings.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: We develop an end-to-end reinforcement learning system that enables robotic hands to perform complex object manipulation tasks without explicit task-specific reward shaping.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Robotic Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a Vision-Language-Action (VLA) model that combines natural language instructions with visual and action data to perform complex dexterous manipulation tasks in unstructured environments.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Imitation from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn dexterous manipulation skills from human demonstrations, using motion capture data and tactile feedback for improved performance.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Object Reorientation
abstract: We propose an efficient optimization algorithm for dexterous object reorientation, reducing computational overhead while maintaining high manipulation performance across various object shapes and sizes.

title: Optimization-Based Grasp Planning for Dexterous Hands
abstract: This paper proposes an optimization-based method for grasp planning that improves the efficiency and reliability of dexterous hand manipulation by considering both geometric and physical constraints.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Object Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We develop a deep reinforcement learning approach for multi-object dexterous manipulation, demonstrating the ability to handle multiple objects simultaneously with high coordination and adaptability.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: This work explores end-to-end imitation learning for dexterous hand manipulation, using neural networks to directly map sensory inputs to motor outputs without explicit feature engineering.

title: Real-Time Control of Dexterous Hands Using Neural Dynamics Models
abstract: This paper presents a neural dynamics model for real-time control of dexterous robotic hands, improving responsiveness and accuracy in dynamic manipulation tasks.

title: Real-Time Control of Dexterous Hands Using Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a deep reinforcement learning approach for real-time control of dexterous robotic hands, enabling them to perform complex manipulation tasks with low latency and high accuracy.

title: Optimal Trajectory Planning for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: We propose an optimal trajectory planning algorithm that improves the efficiency and safety of dexterous manipulation by optimizing motion paths based on physical constraints and task objectives.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation from Human Demonstrations via Imitation Learning
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn dexterous manipulation skills from human demonstrations. The model incorporates both kinematic and tactile feedback to achieve precise control over object interactions.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Multi-Modal Inputs
abstract: We develop an end-to-end learning framework that integrates vision, touch, and proprioception to train dexterous manipulation policies, achieving robust performance across a wide range of objects and tasks.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Expert Policies
abstract: This paper explores efficient imitation learning techniques to transfer expert policies to robotic hands, focusing on reducing training time while maintaining high task performance in dexterous manipulation scenarios.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model that enables robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions and visual input. The model is trained on large-scale multimodal data.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Imitation Learning with Human Demonstrations
abstract: This work explores imitation learning for dexterous hand manipulation by leveraging human demonstrations. The model learns to replicate fine-grained motor skills and adapts to new objects through transfer learning techniques.

title: Optimization-Based Approach for Dexterous Object Manipulation in Cluttered Environments
abstract: This research focuses on optimization techniques for dexterous hand manipulation in cluttered settings. The proposed method improves grasping and regrasping performance by optimizing contact forces and motion trajectories.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Contact-Aware Policies
abstract: This paper introduces an end-to-end reinforcement learning framework that incorporates contact-aware policies for more robust dexterous manipulation. The model is trained using simulated environments and deployed on real robotic hands.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Hands Using Hierarchical Policy Networks
abstract: The paper proposes a hierarchical imitation learning framework that improves the efficiency and generalization of dexterous hand manipulation policies. It combines low-level motor control with high-level task planning.

title: Real-Time Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This study applies model-based reinforcement learning to achieve real-time control of dexterous robotic hands. The method improves sample efficiency and reduces training time compared to traditional model-free approaches.

title: Optimizing Grasp Stability and Manipulation Efficiency with Multi-Objective Optimization
abstract: This paper addresses the problem of optimizing grasp stability and manipulation efficiency in dexterous hands using multi-objective optimization techniques. The approach balances multiple performance criteria during object manipulation.

title: Vision-Language-Action Policies for Generalizable Robotic Manipulation
abstract: We present a vision-language-action policy that allows robots to perform generalizable dexterous manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions and visual context.

title: Model-Based Control of Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: The paper presents a model-based control strategy that leverages learned dynamics models to improve the precision and stability of dexterous hand movements during complex manipulation tasks.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Manipulation from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn complex manipulation skills by imitating human hand motions recorded through motion capture systems.

title: Imitating Human-like Dexterous Manipulation via Imitation Learning and Neural Rendering
abstract: This paper explores the use of neural rendering techniques in combination with imitation learning to enable robotic hands to replicate human-like dexterous behaviors.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model Predictive Control with Uncertainty Quantification
abstract: This paper proposes a robust control framework for dexterous hands that integrates model predictive control with uncertainty quantification to enhance task performance in real-world settings.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Object Reorientation with Contact-Aware Grasps
abstract: We introduce an optimization framework that improves the efficiency of dexterous object reorientation by incorporating contact-aware grasping strategies and real-time feedback.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands via Model Predictive Control with Uncertainty Estimation
abstract: A model predictive control (MPC) approach with uncertainty estimation is proposed for robust dexterous hand control. The method enhances stability and adaptability in dynamic environments.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Object Manipulation with Neural Implicit Representations
abstract: This paper applies neural implicit representations to optimize dexterous object manipulation tasks. The method reduces computational complexity while maintaining high manipulation accuracy.

title: Model-Based Control of Dexterous Hands Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: This work presents a model-based control strategy for dexterous robotic hands using learned dynamics models. The approach improves tracking accuracy and robustness in uncertain environments.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning with Curriculum Training
abstract: This paper proposes a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework that enables dexterous manipulation tasks through curriculum-based training. The method decouples high-level task planning from low-level motor control, improving sample efficiency and performance on complex object manipulation.

title: Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation Using Multimodal Imitation Data
abstract: We present an imitation learning approach that leverages multimodal data (vision, force, and motion) to train a robotic hand for dexterous manipulation tasks. The model demonstrates strong generalization across different objects and environments.

title: Policy Distillation for Dexterous Manipulation with Sparse Rewards
abstract: This paper explores policy distillation techniques to transfer knowledge from expert demonstrations to a dexterous robotic hand, particularly in sparse reward environments. The results show improved performance and stability.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Complex Hand Manipulation Tasks
abstract: An end-to-end imitation learning system is developed for complex hand manipulation tasks, combining vision and tactile feedback. The model achieves high success rates on real-world robotic platforms.

title: Language-Guided Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Language-Action Transformers
abstract: This paper introduces a transformer-based VLA model that enables language-guided manipulation by integrating vision, language, and action modalities. It demonstrates strong performance on open-ended manipulation tasks.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: This paper proposes a model predictive control framework that leverages learned dynamics models to improve the accuracy and efficiency of dexterous hand manipulation. The method is validated through extensive simulation and real-world experiments.

title: Learning Dexterous Grasping from Human Demonstrations via Imitation Learning
abstract: This work presents an imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn grasping strategies from human demonstrations. The model is trained on a large dataset of hand movements and achieves high success rates in various object manipulation tasks.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Uncertainty Estimation
abstract: This paper presents an end-to-end imitation learning approach that incorporates uncertainty estimation to enhance the robustness of dexterous hand manipulation policies. The model is tested on multiple challenging tasks with strong generalization capabilities.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Object Manipulation with a Dextrous Hand
abstract: This study applies deep reinforcement learning to multi-object manipulation tasks using a dexterous robotic hand. The proposed algorithm demonstrates superior performance in handling multiple objects simultaneously.

title: Policy Distillation for Dexterous Manipulation in Sim-to-Real Transfer
abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of sim-to-real transfer in dexterous manipulation by applying policy distillation techniques. The distilled policy shows strong performance when deployed on physical robotic hands.

title: Language-Guided Dexterous Manipulation Using Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: This paper explores the use of vision-language-action models to guide dexterous manipulation tasks using natural language instructions, enabling more intuitive and flexible control of robotic hands.

title: End-to-End Learning for Dexterous Manipulation via Multi-Modal Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents an end-to-end multi-modal reinforcement learning approach that integrates tactile, visual, and proprioceptive feedback to enable robust dexterous manipulation by a robotic hand.

title: Learning from Demonstrations: A Deep Imitation Learning Approach for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: The study introduces a deep imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn complex manipulation tasks from expert demonstrations, focusing on fine-grained motor control and object interaction.

title: Adaptive Control Strategies for Dexterous Robotic Hands in Uncertain Environments
abstract: The paper develops adaptive control algorithms that enhance the performance of dexterous robotic hands in uncertain and dynamic environments, improving stability and precision during object manipulation tasks.

title: Efficient Optimization Techniques for Real-Time Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This research introduces efficient optimization techniques for real-time control of dexterous robotic hands, allowing for faster computation and improved responsiveness during complex manipulation tasks.

title: Imitating Human Hand Movements for Robotic Manipulation Using Imitation Learning
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques to train a robotic hand to replicate human-like hand movements for object manipulation tasks. The model is trained on a large dataset of human hand motions captured using motion capture systems.

title: Imitation Learning for Complex Hand-Object Interactions
abstract: This paper explores imitation learning techniques to capture and replicate complex hand-object interactions, improving the adaptability of robotic hands in real-world settings.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper proposes an adaptive control method that combines deep reinforcement learning with model-based control to improve the performance of dexterous hand manipulation.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Object Manipulation with a Robotic Hand
abstract: We develop an end-to-end reinforcement learning system that enables a robotic hand to manipulate multiple objects simultaneously, showing strong generalization across different scenarios.

title: Optimization-Based Motion Planning for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents an optimization-based motion planning algorithm that enhances the efficiency and robustness of dexterous hand movements in constrained environments.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands
abstract: This paper proposes a model-based control framework for dexterous robotic hands that improves precision and stability during complex manipulation tasks. The approach integrates physics models with real-time feedback for enhanced performance.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents a vision-language-action planning framework that enables robotic hands to perform complex object manipulation tasks based on natural language commands. The model integrates vision, language, and action planning modules for seamless execution.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Manipulation with Uncertain Dynamics
abstract: This research develops an adaptive control strategy for dexterous robotic hands operating in uncertain environments. The controller dynamically adjusts to changes in object properties and environmental conditions, improving robustness and performance.

title: Learning from Demonstration with Hierarchical Imitation Learning for Robotic Hands
abstract: This work proposes a hierarchical imitation learning framework for robotic hands that allows learning complex manipulation skills from expert demonstrations. The method improves sample efficiency and task generalization across different objects and scenarios.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Robotic Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper introduces a novel Vision-Language-Action (VLA) model that enables robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks by understanding natural language instructions and visual inputs.

title: Optimization-Based Planning for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: We present an optimization-based planning framework that enhances the efficiency and robustness of dexterous hand manipulation by leveraging real-time feedback and constraints.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands in Uncertain Environments
abstract: This research focuses on adaptive control techniques that allow dexterous robotic hands to maintain performance in uncertain and changing environments through real-time parameter adjustment.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation with Visual Inputs
abstract: This paper proposes an end-to-end reinforcement learning architecture that enables a robotic hand to learn complex manipulation tasks directly from visual observations without explicit reward shaping.

title: Learning from Demonstrations with Multi-Modal Imitation Learning for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We develop a multi-modal imitation learning method that integrates visual and tactile data to improve the performance of dexterous hand manipulation tasks.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation via Model Predictive Control
abstract: We present an efficient optimization approach using model predictive control to enhance the performance of dexterous robotic hands in real-time manipulation tasks.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Online Optimization
abstract: This work develops an adaptive control strategy that integrates online optimization techniques to enhance the performance of dexterous robotic hands in uncertain and changing environments.

title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper explores multi-task reinforcement learning for dexterous object manipulation, enabling a robotic hand to generalize across multiple objects and tasks with a single policy.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation with Uncertainty Estimation
abstract: We introduce an end-to-end imitation learning framework that incorporates uncertainty estimation to improve the reliability of dexterous hand manipulation in dynamic environments.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Dexterous Manipulation in Real-World Scenarios
abstract: This paper presents a VLA planning framework that allows robotic hands to perform dexterous manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions and visual input.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Policies in High-Dimensional Spaces
abstract: We propose an efficient optimization method for learning dexterous manipulation policies that scales well to high-dimensional robotic systems with complex dynamics.

title: Imitating Human Motor Skills for Dexterous Manipulation Using Deep Learning
abstract: This paper proposes a deep learning framework that mimics human motor skills for dexterous hand manipulation, using motion capture data to train a robotic hand to perform complex object interactions.

title: Vision-Language-Action Planning for Robotic Hand Tasks
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action planning framework that enables robotic hands to perform complex tasks based on natural language instructions, integrating vision, language, and action modules seamlessly.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands via Model-Free and Model-Based Hybrid Approaches
abstract: This paper combines model-free and model-based control strategies to enhance the robustness and adaptability of dexterous hand control systems, particularly in unstructured environments.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Probabilistic Inference
abstract: We present an efficient optimization framework that uses probabilistic inference to improve the performance of dexterous hand manipulation, reducing computational overhead while maintaining accuracy.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model-Based Optimization
abstract: We propose a model-based optimization approach for controlling dexterous hands, which improves performance in uncertain and dynamic manipulation scenarios by leveraging accurate dynamics models.

title: Optimization-Based Policy Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: We present an optimization-based method for learning policies in dexterous manipulation tasks, combining trajectory optimization with policy gradient methods to achieve efficient and effective control.

title: Imitating Human Hand Movements Using Deep Imitation Learning
abstract: We develop a deep imitation learning framework that learns dexterous hand movements from human motion capture data, enabling robots to perform complex manipulation tasks with high precision.

title: Efficient Policy Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation in High-Dimensional Spaces
abstract: This paper introduces an efficient policy optimization algorithm for dexterous manipulation tasks, focusing on scalability and performance in high-dimensional action spaces.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Uncertainty Handling
abstract: This work develops a model predictive control framework tailored for dexterous hand manipulation, incorporating uncertainty estimation to improve robustness in dynamic environments.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Deep Neural Networks
abstract: This research proposes a model-based control strategy for dexterous robotic hands using deep neural networks. The method improves control accuracy and response time in dynamic manipulation scenarios.

title: Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Pose Estimation and Control
abstract: This paper focuses on the integration of pose estimation and control for dexterous hands using reinforcement learning. The method enhances the robot's ability to perform precise and adaptive manipulations.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents a deep reinforcement learning framework for grasping and manipulating objects with a dexterous robotic hand. The method achieves high success rates across diverse object shapes and sizes.

title: Optimization-Based Planning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper explores optimization techniques for planning complex dexterous manipulation tasks, incorporating contact dynamics and kinematic constraints to improve planning efficiency and success rate.

title: Imitating Human-like Hand Movements via Deep Imitation Learning
abstract: This paper demonstrates how deep imitation learning can be used to replicate human-like hand movements on robotic systems, improving dexterity and adaptability in real-world settings.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks Using Gradient-Based Methods
abstract: This paper presents a gradient-based optimization approach for dexterous manipulation, reducing computational overhead while maintaining high task performance in complex scenarios.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Policies
abstract: This paper proposes an efficient optimization technique for training dexterous hand manipulation policies. By reducing computational overhead and improving convergence, the method enables faster learning of complex motor skills.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Control via Imitation and Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This work combines imitation learning with reinforcement learning to train a dexterous robotic hand for complex manipulation tasks. The model learns from human demonstrations and refines its policy through reward-based optimization in a simulated environment.

title: End-to-End Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation with Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents an end-to-end deep reinforcement learning framework for dexterous object manipulation, where the robot learns to perform complex tasks such as object rotation and insertion directly from raw sensory inputs.

title: Imitating Human Hand Movements for Dexterous Robotic Manipulation
abstract: This study explores imitation learning methods to replicate human-like hand movements for robotic manipulation. The proposed approach uses motion capture data to train a dexterous hand to perform fine-grained object manipulation tasks.

title: A Vision-Language-Action Framework for Robotic Manipulation in Unstructured Environments
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) system designed for robotic manipulation in unstructured environments. The model leverages natural language instructions and visual input to guide the robotic hand in performing complex tasks.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Language Guidance
abstract: This paper explores the integration of vision and language guidance to improve dexterous manipulation in robotic hands. We propose a framework that leverages natural language instructions to guide the learning process, enabling more interpretable and controllable manipulation tasks.

title: Vision-Based Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: We present a vision-based imitation learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation, where the robot learns to perform complex object manipulation tasks by observing human demonstrations. The method uses a novel feature extraction module to improve generalization across different objects and environments.

title: Model-Based Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Sparse Rewards
abstract: This paper introduces a model-based reinforcement learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn dexterous manipulation tasks with sparse reward signals. The method combines model predictive control with policy optimization to achieve efficient exploration and stable control.

title: Efficient Motion Planning for Dexterous Hands Using Optimization Techniques
abstract: This paper presents an optimization-based motion planning algorithm for dexterous robotic hands, focusing on minimizing energy consumption while maintaining task performance. The approach integrates kinematic constraints and contact forces to generate feasible and efficient trajectories.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation with Action Embeddings
abstract: We propose an end-to-end imitation learning method that uses action embeddings to capture the temporal structure of manipulation tasks. The model is trained on video demonstrations and achieves high accuracy in replicating complex hand movements on real robots.

title: A Vision-Language-Action Framework for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) framework that allows robotic hands to perform dexterous object manipulation based on natural language instructions. The model combines visual perception, language understanding, and action execution in a unified architecture.

title: Learning Contact-Aware Control Policies for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We develop a contact-aware control policy for robotic hands using deep reinforcement learning. The policy explicitly models contact forces and adapts to varying object properties, improving stability and success rate in complex manipulation tasks.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation via Joint Trajectory and Policy Optimization
abstract: This paper proposes a joint trajectory and policy optimization method for dexterous manipulation tasks. By combining trajectory optimization with policy learning, the system achieves better performance in dynamic and uncertain environments.

title: Reinforcement Learning with Curriculum for Dexterous Hand Tasks
abstract: We apply curriculum learning to reinforce learning for dexterous hand manipulation, gradually increasing task complexity to improve training efficiency and robustness. The approach demonstrates significant improvements in learning speed and task success rates.

title: A Generalizable Imitation Learning Framework for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents a generalizable imitation learning framework that can transfer knowledge from simulated environments to real-world robotic hands. The method improves performance on unseen tasks through domain adaptation and meta-learning techniques.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Using Hierarchical Policies
abstract: The paper introduces a hierarchical imitation learning framework that improves the efficiency and generalization of dexterous manipulation policies by decomposing complex tasks into sub-tasks.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Task-Oriented Robotic Manipulation
abstract: This paper explores the application of Vision-Language-Action models in task-oriented robotic manipulation, enabling hands to perform complex object manipulation based on high-level instructions and visual context.

title: Adaptive Control Strategies for Dexterous Manipulation with Variable Compliance
abstract: This study develops adaptive control strategies for robotic hands, focusing on variable compliance to improve performance in dexterous manipulation tasks involving soft or deformable objects.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation through Joint Trajectory Optimization and Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper combines joint trajectory optimization with model-based reinforcement learning to enhance the precision and adaptability of dexterous hand movements during complex manipulation tasks.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning using a Multi-Modal Policy
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The method uses a multi-modal policy that integrates visual and tactile information to improve task success rates in complex environments.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Manipulation from Human Demonstrations via Imitation Learning
abstract: This work explores imitation learning for dexterous hand manipulation by leveraging human demonstration data. The proposed framework enables robotic hands to replicate complex manipulation skills through behavioral cloning and inverse reinforcement learning.

title: Optimization-Based Planning for Dexterous Grasping and Manipulation
abstract: This research focuses on optimization techniques for grasping and manipulation tasks, proposing a new planning algorithm that improves efficiency and success rate in complex scenarios.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation in Real-World Environments
abstract: This paper presents an end-to-end reinforcement learning system for dexterous hand manipulation, trained in real-world settings to handle unstructured tasks and varying object configurations.

title: End-to-End Optimization for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This research proposes an end-to-end optimization framework for dexterous object manipulation, integrating perception, planning, and control into a unified system for improved performance and reliability.

title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a multi-task reinforcement learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, enabling the agent to learn multiple tasks simultaneously with improved sample efficiency and generalization.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation with State Abstraction
abstract: This study proposes an efficient imitation learning approach that uses state abstraction to reduce complexity and improve performance in dexterous hand manipulation tasks.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Real-Time Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: The paper introduces a real-time VLA model for dexterous hand manipulation, capable of executing complex tasks based on natural language commands with low-latency execution.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Control via Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: This work explores imitation learning for dexterous hand control by learning from human demonstrations. It introduces a novel policy distillation framework that improves generalization and adaptability in real-world settings.

title: Dexterous Hand Manipulation via Imitation Learning with Hierarchical Policy Networks
abstract: We present a hierarchical imitation learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation that combines low-level motor control with high-level task planning. The method improves sample efficiency and generalization across different objects and tasks.

title: Efficient Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation using Model-Based Planning
abstract: This work introduces a model-based reinforcement learning approach that leverages learned dynamics models to improve the efficiency and stability of dexterous manipulation tasks. The method demonstrates superior performance on complex object reorientation problems.

title: Vision-Guided Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands using Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper explores vision-guided control strategies for dexterous robotic hands using deep reinforcement learning. The model learns to adjust hand configurations based on visual feedback, achieving robust manipulation in cluttered environments.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation through Joint Trajectory and Force Optimization
abstract: We propose a novel optimization framework that jointly optimizes trajectory and contact forces for dexterous hand manipulation. The method enhances precision and reduces slipping during object handling tasks.

title: Language-Conditioned Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper presents a language-conditioned reinforcement learning framework that allows robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions. The model demonstrates strong zero-shot generalization capabilities.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation with Variable Contact States
abstract: We develop an end-to-end imitation learning approach that accounts for variable contact states during dexterous manipulation. The method improves performance on tasks involving fine-grained object control and dynamic interactions.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Manipulation in Unstructured Environments
abstract: This paper introduces a VLA model designed for dexterous manipulation in unstructured settings. The model uses language instructions and visual inputs to guide robotic hand actions, demonstrating strong adaptability to new tasks and objects.

title: Model-Free Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Control with Sparse Rewards
abstract: This work addresses the challenge of sparse reward signals in dexterous hand control by proposing a model-free reinforcement learning algorithm that efficiently learns complex manipulation skills with limited supervision.

title: Optimal Contact Planning for Dexterous Manipulation using Sequential Optimization
abstract: We present a sequential optimization framework for optimal contact planning in dexterous manipulation tasks. The method improves grasp stability and reduces computational overhead compared to traditional approaches.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Language Grounding
abstract: This paper proposes a vision-language-action (VLA) model that enables dexterous manipulation by grounding language instructions in visual observations. The model is trained on a large-scale dataset of human demonstrations and achieves strong performance on object rearrangement tasks.

title: Optimal Control Strategies for Multi-Fingered Robotic Hands
abstract: This work presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks.

title: VLA-Hand: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks.

title: Imitation Learning for Complex Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We explore imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation from Suboptimal Experts
abstract: We present a method for learning dexterous manipulation skills from suboptimal human demonstrations using reinforcement learning.

title: Language-Conditioned Vision-Action Policies for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This work introduces language-conditioned vision-action policies that allow robotic hands to perform dexterous manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions, improving task generalization and user interaction.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands via Adaptive Model-Predictive Control
abstract: This paper presents an adaptive model-predictive control method for dexterous robotic hands, designed to handle uncertainties and disturbances while maintaining high precision in manipulation tasks.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Manipulation via Imitation and Self-Supervised Exploration
abstract: This work proposes an imitation learning framework that combines expert demonstrations with self-supervised exploration to improve the robustness of dexterous hand manipulation in unstructured environments. It demonstrates superior performance on tasks such as object flipping and tool use.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Uncertainty Awareness
abstract: This paper presents an end-to-end imitation learning method that incorporates uncertainty estimation to enhance the robustness of dexterous hand manipulation in dynamic and uncertain environments.

title: Vision-Guided Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Reorientation
abstract: The study explores a vision-guided reinforcement learning approach that enables robotic hands to reorient objects through continuous interaction, leveraging visual feedback for improved task success rates.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper proposes an efficient optimization strategy for dexterous manipulation using model predictive control, which balances computational cost and task performance in real-time robotic applications.

title: End-to-End Learning for Dexterous Object Reorientation
abstract: This paper proposes an end-to-end learning framework for object reorientation tasks using a dexterous robotic hand. The model learns to predict optimal grasping and manipulation strategies directly from raw sensor data.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Hands Using Hierarchical Policies
abstract: We present a hierarchical imitation learning approach that decomposes complex manipulation tasks into subtasks. This structure allows for more efficient learning and better generalization across different objects and scenarios.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We combine model-based reinforcement learning with control theory to create a robust controller for dexterous hands. The approach improves stability and reduces the need for extensive online training.

title: Optimizing Contact Forces for Dexterous Manipulation with Deep Learning
abstract: This paper introduces a deep learning-based method for optimizing contact forces during dexterous manipulation. The model predicts optimal force distributions to prevent object slippage and improve task success rates.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands using Model Predictive Control
abstract: This research applies model predictive control (MPC) to enhance the performance of dexterous robotic hands in uncertain environments. The method improves tracking accuracy and reduces motion errors during complex manipulation tasks.

title: Dexterous Manipulation via Multi-Modal Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper investigates multi-modal reinforcement learning for dexterous hand manipulation, combining visual, tactile, and proprioceptive feedback to improve policy robustness and adaptability in dynamic environments.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Real-Time Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This work develops an efficient imitation learning framework that enables real-time execution of dexterous manipulation tasks on robotic hands. The approach reduces training time and improves generalization across different objects and scenarios.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Manipulation with Uncertainty Estimation
abstract: We propose a model-based control strategy that incorporates uncertainty estimation to enhance the reliability of dexterous manipulation in uncertain environments.

title: Vision-Language Planning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language planning framework that enables robotic hands to manipulate objects based on natural language instructions and visual perception.

title: Reinforcement Learning with Hierarchical Policies for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn complex manipulation tasks through structured policy decomposition.

title: Imitation Learning with Attention Mechanisms for Dexterous Hand Control
abstract: We propose an imitation learning approach that integrates attention mechanisms to improve the learning of complex hand manipulation tasks from expert demonstrations.

title: Optimizing Grasp and Manipulation Policies Using Model-Based Control
abstract: This paper presents a model-based control framework that optimizes grasp and manipulation policies for robotic hands. It combines trajectory optimization with real-time feedback for improved stability and accuracy.

title: Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Reorientation with Contact-Aware Policies
abstract: This work introduces a contact-aware reinforcement learning approach for dexterous object reorientation. The model explicitly considers contact dynamics to improve performance in challenging manipulation tasks.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action (VLA) model that enables end-to-end learning of dexterous manipulation tasks using natural language instructions and visual inputs.

title: Efficient Optimization of Robotic Hand Movements Using Probabilistic Inference
abstract: This paper proposes a probabilistic inference-based method for optimizing robotic hand movements. The approach improves efficiency and robustness in dynamic manipulation scenarios.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Sparse Rewards
abstract: We develop a deep reinforcement learning algorithm that effectively handles sparse reward signals in dexterous manipulation tasks. The method achieves strong performance on complex object manipulation benchmarks.

title: Imitating Human-like Hand Movements through Multi-modal Imitation Learning
abstract: This paper presents a multi-modal imitation learning framework that captures both visual and kinematic aspects of human hand movements, enabling more natural and precise robotic manipulation.

title: Imitating Human Skill for Robotic Dexterous Manipulation through Hierarchical Imitation Learning
abstract: The paper presents a hierarchical imitation learning approach that mimics human skill in dexterous manipulation tasks. It combines low-level motor control with high-level task planning to achieve more robust and adaptable behavior.

title: Efficient Motion Planning for Dexterous Hands Using Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper proposes a motion planning algorithm for dexterous hands using model predictive control (MPC). The method improves trajectory smoothness and reduces computational overhead during real-time execution.

title: Optimizing Dexterous Manipulation Through Joint Trajectory and Contact Optimization
abstract: This research presents a joint optimization framework for trajectory and contact forces in dexterous manipulation. The method enhances stability and precision in handling delicate objects.

title: Optimization-Based Grasp Planning for Dexterous Hands in Cluttered Environments
abstract: This research focuses on optimizing grasp planning for dexterous hands in cluttered environments. The proposed method uses trajectory optimization to find stable and feasible grasps in complex scenes.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation with Sparse Rewards
abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of sparse reward signals in dexterous manipulation tasks by introducing an end-to-end reinforcement learning framework that improves exploration and task completion rates.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation with a Shadow Hand
abstract: We present an end-to-end reinforcement learning system that enables a Shadow Hand to manipulate objects in cluttered environments using only raw sensory inputs.

title: Imitating Human Dexterity: A Large-Scale Dataset and Imitation Learning Framework
abstract: This paper introduces a large-scale dataset of human hand movements and proposes an imitation learning framework that improves the performance of robotic dexterous manipulation.
